title: Police investigate possible murder-suicide in northeast Baltimore
content:
BALTIMORE —
A man and his 11-year-old son were found dead in a parked car in northeast Baltimore on Sunday morning, and police are investigating their deaths as an apparent murder-suicide.
Baltimore City police said several officers came upon the crime scene while on their regular patrols in the 1900 block of 62nd Street.
Around 9:15 a.m., the officers said they noticed a dark-colored sport utility vehicle parked along the shoulder of the road, which is in an industrial area of the city. When officers approached the SUV, they said they saw a man his son in the back seat with gunshot wounds to their heads.
Both were pronounced dead at the scene.
Police identified the boy Monday as Matthew Thomas, 11, of Baltimore, and his father as Warren Everette Thomas, 54, of Baltimore.
No other details were released.
Anyone with information about the incident is asked to call homicide detectives at 410-396-2100.
The victims were two of five whose lives were claimed by gunfire this weekend.
WBALTV.com editor Katie Lange and WBAL-TV 11 News reporter Karen Campbell contributed to this article
